column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Blast-hit Exxon refinery recently cited for violations - California
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 19 The Exxon Mobil Corp XOM.N refinery in Torrance  California  that was hit by an explosion this week was cited last year for eight serious violations following state inspections  but a review cleared the plant this month of all but two serious violations and 12 general violations.

column4: Santos holds back on dividend hike as oil slump bites

column4: UAW chief: Raise worker pay  keep companies competitive

column4: U.S. factory activity edges up in February: Markit

column4: Exclusive: UAW president calls GM share buyback proposal premature

column4: REFILE-UAW president cautions on GM share buyback proposal

column4: CORRECTED-Novo Nordisk has positive trial results for oral GLP-1 drug  shares jump
column5: COPENHAGEN  Feb 20 Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk   the world's biggest insulin maker  said on Friday it had received positive results from a phase 2 trial of an oral version of a long-acting GLP-1 for treatment of people with type 2 diabetes.

column4: BRIEF-Novo Nordisk completes phase 2 for an oral formulation of long-acting GLP-1

column5: Hedge fund BlueMountain Capital Management LLC sent a second default notice to an affiliate of mortgage servicer Ocwen Financial Corp over certain notes it holds.

column4: Exclusive: Orbital explosion probe said to find debris in engine: sources
column5: WASHINGTON Last October's explosion of Orbital ATK Inc's Antares rocket may have been triggered when debris inadvertently left in a fuel tank traveled into the booster's main engine  two people familiar with investigations into the accident told Reuters.

column4: Insight: Brazilian companies push for deal to minimize Petrobras scandal
column5: SAO PAULO Some of the companies caught up in a massive corruption scandal at state-run oil firm Petrobras are quietly pressing Brazil's government and judiciary to strike a "grand bargain" to minimize the legal fallout  five sources with knowledge of the talks say.

column4: Petrobras could cost 5 percent of Brazil GDP in bailout: Moody's
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO State-run Petroleo Brasileiro SA could cost Brazil an amount equal to 5 percent of its gross domestic product in the event of a Treasury bailout  a senior analyst with Moody's Investors Service said  underscoring the potential impact on public finances of a massive corruption scandal at the oil firm.

column4: UPDATE 1-Sanofi's new boss could earn more than Total's  less than Pfizer's
column5: PARIS  Feb 20 Sanofi's new boss Olivier Brandicourt could earn up to 4.2 million euros ($4.8 million) a year at the drugs group and  pocket an extra 4 million euros within 12 months as a one-off golden handshake.

column4: RBS poised to take four billion pounds hit on value of U.S. bank Citizens: sources
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland  is likely to write down the value of its U.S. bank Citizens by about 4 billion pounds ($6.2 billion) next week  industry sources said  potentially wiping out much of the state-backed bank's annual profit.

column5: MOSCOW  Feb 20 Russia's Eurasia Drilling  said on Friday it was delaying a deal to sell a stake in the company to oil services giant Schlumberger while it waited for approval from a Russian regulator.

column4: Russia's Eurasia Drilling says merger with Schlumberger delayed
column5: MOSCOW  Feb 20 Russia's Eurasia Drilling  said on Friday it was delaying a deal to sell a stake in the company to Schlumberger  pending approval from Russia's Federal Anti-Monopoly Service (FAS).

column4: UPDATE 2-Japan Display in talks with Apple to build iPhone screen plant -source
column5: TOKYO  Feb 20 Japan Display Inc is considering building a plant to supply smartphone screens for Apple Inc and is negotiating with the U.S. company for investment in the project  a person familiar with the situation said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Marcato pressures Sotheby's to buy back shares  replace CFO
column5: Feb 20 Activist investor Marcato Capital Management LP said auction house Sotheby's should repurchase $500 million stock immediately and replace its chief financial officer  a week after the company said there will be no return of capital.

column4: Telecom Italia aims to list tower unit before summer
column5: LONDON  Feb 20 Italian phone group Telecom Italia Chief Executive Marco Patuano said on Friday he expected to list a minority stake in its domestic mobile towers business before the summer.

column4: Telecom Italia says conditions not there for Metrwoeb deal
column5: LONDON  Feb 20 Telecom Italia Chairman Giuseppe Recchi said on Friday its board had concluded that conditions were not in place to buy a stake in Italian fiber network provider Metroweb although the group remained interested in the asset.

column4: Telecom Italia lifts 3-yr investment goal  sees no ordinary div
column5: MILAN  Feb 20 Telecom Italia lifted its three-year investment target on Friday to 14.5 billion euros ($16.4 billion) and said it had launched steps to list its Italian mobile towers.

column4: Telecom Italia FY revenues  core profit drop
column5: MILAN  Feb 20 Telecom Italia posted lower full-year revenues and core profits on Friday but said that domestic sales continued to recover throughout the year thanks to improvements in its fixed and mobile businesses.

column5: LONDON  Feb 20 Platinum's discount to gold hit its highest level on Friday since the gold price crash of April 2013  as concerns over the euro zone outlook lifted demand for the yellow metal as a haven  while dampening sentiment towards platinum.
